answerText: A Suitable Boy[10] A Suitable Boy was written by Vikram Seth, whose novel-in-verse The Golden Gate employed the stanza used in this earlier novel-in-verse by Alexander Pushkin.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 7 | 18 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, Lata carries on a flirtation with Kabir. For 10 points each: [10] Name this long novel in which Mrs. Rupa Mehra attempts to find the title character and marry off her daughter.
